intro: Braconotia juncea, commonly known as the slender bracon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and linear leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Braconotia juncea is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
